body.p:
NO. 12.
The State of Kentucky,
To Chas. D. Hillman Dr.
1862
DOLLARS. CENTS
August To 2 months service as 2nd Lieutenant and recruiting Officer 8: Ky Cavry -- 220 00
(Lt. Hillman was mustered into U.S. service by Col Seawell. on July 29. 1862.)
Approved By order of the Governor
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services were rendered as stated; and that they were necessary for the public service

xJ M Shackelford
Col 8th Ky Cavalry

Received at Frankfort, Ky April 11. 1863, the of, 186. of Jno W. Finnell Adj Genl, Quarter-master Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Two hundred and twenty Dollars and -- Cents, in full of the above account.

NO. 12.
No. 154 Abstract B P Qr. 186
Chas D Hillman
Dollars 22000/100
Paid April 11 1863

Head Quarters U. S. Forces
Henderson Octr 22. 1862.

I do certify that the within named Chas D Hillman was commissioned as 2nd Lieutenant in the 8 Ky Cavalry -- commanded by me. That he was mustered into the U service for the purpose of recruiting a Company. that he recruited and had sixty odd men in Camp. Him and his men were rejected by order of the Adjutant General of the State there being a larger excess recruited for my regiment. He was engaged in recruiting and awaiting orders two months.

J M Shackelford
Col Comd'g 8th Ky Cavalry
